The Math Academy is a PUSD program aimed at radically accelerating the learning curve of its mathematically gifted students by providing a curriculum that matches their abilities. The goal of Math Academy is to prepare these students to excel in the honors math and science programs at the most elite universities in the world. Math Academy begins in the 6th grade at several of our middle schools and continues at the high school level at Pasadena High School Bulldogs.

The courses our high school students are currently taking include Linear Algebra Multivariable Vector Calculus and Abstract Algebra Discrete Math Differential Equations. More on the Math Academy program and curriculum can be found at mathacademy.us.

Pictured here are our Math Academy students and their instructor Dr. Hiren Maharaj.

November 15, 2019 at 10:39 PM ¬∑

Here they are! Our future John Muir High School Early College Magnet students! Today Muir held their District wide 8th Grade Shadow Day. Through a series of small world connections a big deal connection was made between VADA class of 2020 student Brooklynn Alfred and NASA research mathematician Katherine Johnson.

Brooklynn was inspired by Mrs. Johnson's story and chose to honor her in an award winning design focused on heroes of aviation for the Hollywood Burbank airport. Katherine Johnson is an African-American mathematician whose calculations of orbital mechanics as a NASA employee were critical to the success of the first and subsequent U.S. manned spaceflight. Mrs Johnson's granddaughter shared the artwork created by Brooklynn with her, that moment captured in these photographs. Also pictured is the design which will be printed 26 feet tall and will hang on the Hollywood Burbank Airport tower this year. What an honor!

On Friday, February 22, 2019 Pasadena High School Bulldogs had the pleasure of welcoming a group of volunteers from the TCS Education System to our campus. As part of the Pasadena Educational Foundation Outreach Volunteer initiative we welcomed volunteers from the TCS Education System whose task was to assist us on a project of our choice. The task selected was to paint and upgrade our Bulldog Baseball Diner.

Thank you to all the volunteers. We very much appreciate your support. Our group was one of five groups commissioned by Allison Pultz, the PEF Volunteer Coordinator for projects on four other PUSD school campuses.

TCS Education System is a nonprofit system of colleges advancing student success and community impact.
https://www.tcsedsystem.edu/

More information on the work of the Pasadena Educational Foundation can be found on their website http://pasedfoundation.org/
